summary: The Goliath birdeater is the world's largest spider by size and weight. Native to South America, it can grow up to 5 inches long and weigh up to 6 ounces. Despite its name, it doesn't usually eat birds; the name comes from an old illustration showing one eating a hummingbird. It belongs to the tarantula family and is also known as the Goliath tarantula.
title: Goliath birdeater
